FuncDef:
The access-speed cu adjustment system-state user-type command configures one or more user types for which the device adjusts the user access rate based on the control channel status.
The undo access-speedcu adjustment system-state user-type command cancels the configuration.
By default, the device adjusts the user access rate based on the control channel status for all types of users.
CLIs: access-speed cu adjustment system-state user-type { { dhcp | pppoe | ipv4-trigger | ipv6-trigger | dhcpv6 | l2tp } * | none }
undo access-speed cu adjustment system-state user-type [ dhcp | pppoe | ipv4-trigger | ipv6-trigger | dhcpv6 | l2tp ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the device does not adjust the user access rate based on the control channel status for any type of user.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI-aaa] undo access-speed cu adjustment system-state user-type dhcp
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, the device adjusts the user access rate based on the control channel status for all types of users. To disable the device from adjusting the user access rate based on the control channel status for one or more specified types of users, run the undo access-speed cu adjustment system-state user-type [ dhcp | pppoe | ipv4-trigger| ipv6-trigger | l2tp ] * command.
Prerequisites
The CUSP has been configured on the CP. For details, see Configuring a CUSP controller (CP).
